intro: Deschampsia cespitosa subsp. festucifolia, commonly known as silver hairgrass, is a grass species native to North America. It is characterized by its fine, silver-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. This subspecies typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as meadows, marshes, and along stream banks.
